column92: Cell type; harmonized based on Cell Ontology (CL). Note that more detailed (non-ontology-based) cell type names are available under \ann_finest_level\"
column93: and hierarchical annotations can be found \"ann_level_[1-5]\" "
column103: Age, harmonized/encoded based on HsapDv ontology. Slightly higher resolution, non-ontology-based ages are available under \age_or_mean_of_age_range\""
column113: Disease, harmonized based on Mondo ontology. Slighly higher resolution, non-ontology-based disease categories can be found under lung_condition
column123: Donor-id, formatted as \homosapiens_None_2023_None_sikkemalisa_001_d10_1101_2022_03_10_483747[DONORID]\" for the core
column134: Indicates if the cells are part of an earlier dataset on cellxgene
column144: Ethnicity, harmonized based on HANCESTRO ontology
column154: Sex, self-reported or as reported by physician
column164: Whether cells or nuclei were used for sequencing
column174: Anatomical region sequenced, harmonized based on UBERON/CL
column215: Age range for donor for which no specific age was given but only a range
column225: For cells from the HLCA core: Final annotations by the HLCA expert team, at the level that was used for GWAS and covariate modeling analysis (see paper for more info). These are often not the finest levels of annotation available.
column235: For cells from the HLCA core: Final annotations by the HLCA expert team, shown at the finest level of detail available for every cell. For cells not in the core (i.e. added during HLCA extesnion, only present in the full HLCA): finest labels as transferred from the core to the extension by label transfer. Cell labels with a label transfer uncertainty higher than 0.2 are set to unknown.
column245: For cells from the HLCA core: Final annotations by the HLCA expert team, broken down into levels (1 coarsest, 5 finest). Where annotations do not go up to level 5, levels without annotations are set to None. For cells not in the core (i.e. added during HLCA extesnion, only present in the full HLCA): labels of the given annotation level as transferred from the core to the extension by label transfer. Cell labels with a label transfer uncertainty higher than 0.2 are set to unknown.
column265: Whether a given cell is also present in the HLCA core, or only in the full HLCA (\extension\")"
column275: Dataset. This was the variable used for batch correction and data integration. Often corresponds to \study\"
column276: although some studies were split into multiple datasets
column277: e.g. based on sequencing platform. See the HLCA paper for more information on dataset definition."
column287: Whether cells come from a fresh or frozen sample.
column307: Specification of ethnicity/ancestry where a donor was reported as being of mixed ethnicity/ancestry.
column317: Original cell type labels, as provided by datasets generators broken down into levels (1 coarsest, 5 finest). To resolve differences in nomenclature and level of annotation detail, these annotations are harmonized based on a mapping of provided labels to a hierarchical common label reference. Where annotations do not go up to level 5, levels without annotations are set to None. Note that a full re-annotation was performed after integration by a HLCA expert team. These annotations can be found under \ann_level_[1-5]\"."
column327: Original cell type labels before any harmonizing of labels was done.
column337: For cells from the HLCA core: Comparison of \original_ann_level_[1-5]\" to \"ann_level_[1-5]\". If original and final annotations are contradictory
column338: cells are labeled as \"Misannotated\". Where original labels were correct
column339: but less detailed than final annotations
column340: cells are labeled as \"Underannotated\". Where annotations match both in label and level of annotation
column361: For the HLCA core: cell type label (from \original_ann_level_[1-5]\") as used for integration with scANVI"
column401: Status of donor when sample was taken; subdivided into \alive_healthy\"
column402: \"alive_disease\" and \"organ_donor\". More details can be inferred from \"tissue_sampling_method\"."
column412: Anatomical location of sample (coarse), as labeled in original datasets. For harmonized anatomical location information, see \tissue_level_[1-3]\"."
column422: Anatomical location of sample (detailed), as labeled in original datasets. For harmonized anatomical location information, see \tissue_level_[1-3]\"."
column432: Protocol used for tissue dissociation into single cells
column442: Anatomical location of sample in more detail where available. For coarsest level, see ontology-based variable \tissue\"."
column452: Method by which a sample was obtained, e.g. \biopsy\" or \"autopsy\"."
column462: For cellx only in the full HLCA (i.e. cells in the HLCA extension), and not in the core: label as transferred from the HLCA core, from coarsest (1) to finest (5) where available. Note that these different levels could contradict each other, given the label transfer algorithm. Furthermore, note that even labels transfered with a high uncertainty are retained here. See \ann_level_[1-5]\" for filtered transfered labels
column463: where labels with an uncertainty >0.2 are set to unknown."
column494: Donor age, or mean of age range where only a range was given. Original age ranges can be found under \age_range\"."
column504: Anatomical region as encoded in a continuous \common coordinate framework\" score
column505: with lowest (0) corresponding to most proximal (nose) and highest (1) corresponding to most distal (lung parenchyma). See paper for futher details on encoding."
column525: Entropy of category (e.g. subject_ID, dataset) among cells, at level 3 leiden clusters. This score quantifies the diversity in terms of a category among the cells of a cluster.
column535: HLCA core clustering, broken down into levels (1 coarsest, 5 finest). Nested clustering was performed, with parent clusters specified in cluster names.
column545: Logartihm (base 10) of total UMI counts per cell.
column555: Number of genes detected per cell.
column565: Highest resolution at which original cell type labels were available for a given cell.
column575: Reference genome used for read alignment.
column585: SCRAN normalization factors used to normalize counts in the HLCA core
column605: Uncertainty of label transfer at a given annotation level, for cells only present in the full HLCA (=HLCA extension)
column635: For HLCA core: SCRAN-normalized, log-transformed counts. For full HLCA: total-counts normalized, log-transformed counts. Raw counts were normalized for all datasets, except for Meyer_2021, for which  soupX'ed counts were normalized (see layer 'soupX').
column655: Counts corrected for ambient RNA using soupX. Corrected counts were only used for the Meyer_2021 dataset, all other studies are set to 0 in this layer.
column685: CELLxGENE variable, False for all cells
column695: For the full HLCA, gene name harmonization was done to set all datasets to the same genome annotation version where possible (ensembl 107)
column725: HLCA core: scANVI-based integarted and batch-corrected embedding. Cells present only in the full HLCA (=HLCA extension) were mapped in the same embedding space using scArches.
column735: UMAP embedding of the cells, based on X_scanvi_emb.
